definition: to be full of wit and humor

sentences.english: It is an anthology that crackles with wit and wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 這是一本妙語連珠篇篇充滿智慧的文集。

sentences.english: She sometimes comes out with the most extraordinary remarks.
sentences.chinese: 她有時說出的話妙語如珠。

sentences.english: The comedian's ad-libs were quoted in the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 那喜劇演員的脫口妙語被引述在報紙上。

sentences.english: He has a genius for epigram.
He often sets the table a-roaring with a well-placed bon mot.
sentences.chinese: 他經常以恰到好處的珠璣妙語使滿桌的人鬨堂大笑。

sentences.english: When he tells stories, he narrates vividly and humourously, making witty remarks. Every one likes to listen.
sentences.chinese: 他講故事時生動風趣妙語聯珠，大家都很喜歡聽。

sentences.english: A talk full of attic salt is worth listening to.
sentences.chinese: 滿是優雅妙語的談話值得一聽。

sentences.english: I enjoy listening to their witty repartee.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜歡聽他們妙語連珠的對答。

sentences.english: And New Yorkers pride themselves on quick quip or a biting sarcastic remark.
sentences.chinese: 紐約人也很自豪能夠妙語如珠或出言挑釁的諷刺。

sentences.english: To make or utter a wisecrack.
sentences.chinese: 她有時說出的話妙語如珠。

sentences.english: But you always get a smile and some witty repartee from him that provides an uplift.
sentences.chinese: 但柏利總是笑容可掬，妙語如珠，讓你精神一振。

sentences.english: There are many mots in that book.
You were scintillating on TV last night.
sentences.chinese: 您昨晚在電視上妙語如珠。

definition: luan and phoenix/husband and wife/virtuous person/sovereign/belle
(literary) to practice medicine/to work as a pharmacist
see 呂洞賓|吕洞宾[Lu:3 Dong4 bin1]
see 清風明月|清风明月[qing1 feng1 ming2 yue4]
to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
Luo Binwang (640-684), one of Four Great Poets of the Early Tang 初唐四傑|初唐四杰[Chu1 Tang2 Si4 jie2]
